detailsOfAchievement: Jeppiaar Engineering college (MBA) , Department of Management studies was started in the year 2001, affiliated to Anna University Chennai and Approved by AICTE, New Delhi with an intake of 60 students. In the year 2007, the intake was increased to 120 with TWO sections. We have 4 Professors, 2 Associate Professors and remaining are Assistant Professors working in the MBA department. We offer 6 different electives such as Human Resource, Marketing, Finance, Operations,Logistics and Shipping and Systems. The Department has given a consistent result of 95% & has produced a total of 1280 successful MBA graduates in the last 13 batches along with 70 University Ranks including 1 Gold Medal. The Department also provides Training and Placement to our students to ensure that more than 90% of students get placed every year through on & off Campus interviews in the reputed companies like Wipro, Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS), RR Donnelley, ICICI , BNY Mellon, TVS, IndusInd Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, HDFC, Butterfly, VGP Snow kingdom, Redington, NTT Data, Trade India, Omics, Zylo Systems, BASE Automation, Face, Jaro Education, etc with annual salary package of 2.5 lakhs to 5.0 lakhs. We have also signed MoUs with many Professional Bodies like Madras Management Association (MMA), Confederation of Indian Industry (CII), Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Development Institute, Chennai (MSMEDI), Ministry of MSME, New Delhi, Entrepreneurship Development Institute of India (EDII) Ahmadabad, National Stock Exchange (NSE) of India, Mumbai, National Entrepreneurship Network (NEN), Sustainable Education and Entrepreneurship Development (SEED), Rotract Club for the welfare of the students. Entrepreneurship Development Cell was commenced in the year 2005 to nurture the skills of entrepreneurship and groom entrepreneurs for the growth and development of our nation. Graduates instead of depending only on job as a medium of their career, they are provided with an alternative to get self-employed and pave the way for many more employment opportunities as Entrepreneurs through EDC. I am happy to inform you that six of our alumni students had become Entrepreneurs in the last 5 years. Our Department has got the following Funded Projects. o AICTE sponsored Staff Development Programme on Financial Analysis of Business Concern which was held during April 26th to May 7th 2010 - The project was completed. o TNSCST  DIT Sponsored project in October 2010 on Empowerment of Women on Entrepreneurship  The project was also completed. o National Commission of Women sponsored a project on A Study on Compliance to provisions of Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace, with the focus on Private sector in TamilNadu- It is ongoing project. o ICSSR Sponsored Seminar was organized in the month of February 2015 on SMART CITIES  The way Ahead of Inclusive Exclusive growth- The project was completed.  Our students M.G. Rakhee & Sakthibala.S won state volleyball championship & they represented senior national Tamilnadu volleyball team and represented Anna University. detailsOfAchievement: Activities of Karunalaya  Prevention, Rescue and Rehabiliation of runaway, destitute, Street Children and Psycosocial Support.  Shelter Home Care for Children in need of Care and Protection  Rescue of Child Labourers, enrolment in Formal School & supplementary education  Sports for Development for the street and slum children  Protection and empowerment of children from abuse and exploitation  STI, HIV/AIDS intervention among FSWs and Street Children  Family Counselling and Empowerment of Women, SHGs  Counselling, referral for deaddiction treatment for husbands of SHG women and youth  Shelter for the Homeless  Vocational Training  Disaster Relief and Rehabilitation Achievements of Karunalaya  Certificate of Appreciation by Honorable Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu Dr. J. Jayalalitha for the valuable service rendered by Karunalaya Social Service Society in rehabilitating the tsunami affected people of Chennai District for facilitating the construction of safe and improved semi permanent houses at Ernavoor in the year 2005.  National Child Labour Project best teacher award by the worshipful Mayor of Chennai for the best performance in 2010.  Karunalaya had the Honour of being invited to bring Team India to the Street Child World Cup in Brazil, 2014, a Street Children from Karunalaya participated Street Child World Cup in Brazil 2014 and won FAIR PLAY Award.  Five street children represented Team India and participated in street child games 2016 at Rio, Brazil. Hepsiba a 15 year old girl from Kannaparthidal won Gold medal in 100 meters, Silver medal in 400 meters and Bronze medal in 110 meter hurdles. Our shelter home boy Ashok won bronze medal in shot put. Usha a girl from barrack road expressed the ordeals faced by street children in India while participating in street child congress held at Rio.  Our Director Dr. N. Paul Sunder Singh was presented an award of appreciation for his highly praise worthy effort to strengthen ties between India and SriLanka through activities that promote the well-being of the younger generation by the Children Skill Development Programme, Srilanka.  Dr. N. Paul Sunder Singh, Secretary of Karunalaya received the Prof. M. Vishwanathan Outstanding Social Service Award 2015, for the rescue and rehabilitating of Street children Chennai an award was given by MV Hospital for Diabetes, Royapuram.  Sr. Rita Thyvettil memorial award for best women group and Childrens Club of Karunalaya towards committed service in eradicated of Child labour in 2002.  Sr. Rita Thyvettil memorial award for best Childrens Club of Karunalaya towards committed service in eradicated of Child labour in 2003.  STD,HIV/AIDS intervention among street children from 2002 to 2007. Targeted intervention among FSW from 2008 to 2016. Referred around 1000 FSWs to undergo testing and treatment for STI, HIV/ AIDS.  350 cases were referred to Karunalaya Family Counselling Centre in which cases of Domestic Violence, Child Sexual Abuse, Child Marriage, Alcohol and Drug Abuse are addressed.  1500 runaway children have been reintegrated with their parents after tracing their families.  302 SHGs formed and facilitated credit linkage with Banks through Tamil Nadu Women Development Corporation

detailsOfAchievement: Dr. Lt. K.P. Sridhar is the managing trustee in Karupa foundation and he is involved in the field of rescue operations for past 12 years and he has designed a Robot to rescue children from bore-well in the year 2003 and the same was implemented in various operations and also was tested and approved by IIT Madras and it has been implemented in Government of Tamil Nadu in the year 2014. With the help of his Robot, he has rescued a kid from Bore Well in ARCOT VELLOR on 12 APRIL 2015, in 20 minutes of his arrival. Same, in Karur, he has rescued in 15 minutes after his arrival to the spot, these rescue published in Press. He has involved himself in various operations in various places like Karur, Thyagadurgam, Thiruvannamalai, Vellore and Arni. He has trained Fire and Rescue Department, Govt of Tamil Nadu for such operations at Coimbatore and Ambatur District. The participants were Fire Officer Range and his training was appreciated by the officials and received citation for that operations. He was called by NDRF (National Disaster Response Force) to sign a MoU for further rescue operations and it is in process of drafting MoU and communicating for the final sitting. He has been to the above said operations in his own expenses and did all the operations even as a salaried person, he never claimed fund for rescue purpose even not from any agency, he presented his project in various opportunities and got various awards for this Project. He was one of the resource persons to give awareness on rescue robots in various institutions in and around Tamil Nadu and created may programmes to make the public, aware of the disasters in many academic places
